Photo of Que Onda Tacos + Tequila - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chimichanga Burrito

SkjWJwzCJ61pqW2fps9iYg.text: We had a GREAT experience with our 3 kids last week. GREAT food, Great service at that time so we went back again this weekend at same time.  Our teenage son had a sandwich with him so the first thing they told us was that he could NOT eat with us his sandwich. We asked for kids options and they told us they weren't any. (Which is weird since last time there was.).  It was not what he said but the lack of tact and customer service he did with. When we asked to talk to manager he, Miguel, said he was manager. He said that we should have asked before eating there. He also said that we should know this. There was no empathy felt.   He lost repeat customers.   Unfortunately we left feeling unwelcomed and disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Que Onda Tacos + Tequila - Charlotte, NC, United States

TyfwL04Q3ERDKK1-gccrJg.text: With a name like "Que Onda" simply made me want to stop by and check this joint out. There are so many eating options in DT Charlotte and I'm sure they were all good, but I'm always drawn to eating my beloved Mexican food. I was well pleased with establishment.   Decor-loved Mexican artwork on walls, it wasn't like all Mexican joints trying too hard to capture Dia se Los Muertos and other skull art. This place was unique in its paintings, it had corn and other cool unique studs not just skulls and hipster art.   Service-was good, nothing overly positive but up to par.   Food- chips and salsa were good. Chips perfectly crunchy and not oily at all, salsa fresh with a hint of spice. Shrimp cocktail was good. It had jicama, which I had never seen and had good flavor. It was also rather large dish. Chicken Tortilla Soup was well put together and had all the elements I'm jaded to having in a soup and was also a large portion.   All in all, next time I'm in Charlotte, I might be tempered to come back.

Photo of Que Onda Tacos + Tequila - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Creamy Tortilla Soup-I really liked this soup and also larger portion then I expected.

Z1Vg1y2bbyd37kt0hJGuXg.text: Great food! Nice atmosphere. Taco Tuesday $2, craft beer $3! Great service and. Location!

photos.caption: Photo of Que Onda Tacos + Tequila - Charlotte, NC, United States

NkM3t0aAf7bfGrcceLpIaQ.text: Aaaaaaaaand I just had it.  My first bad experience at Que Onda.  I'm sad to write this but I think it's a big enough deal that people should know.  They do have black beans.  They won't heat them up for you, even if the place is only half-full and you want it to come out with your regular meal which takes 30 minutes anyway because, "the kitchen is too busy to microwave them; you can only order them cold."  I've ordered all kinds of crazy things in the past, including hold out stuff, swapping ingredients, and making special drinks.  I've never had anyone say anything like this to me before.  And this before not getting my actual meal to me until I've asked for it more than 20 minutes after the rest of my table got their food.    Excuse me, Miss, did that table get my meal?  Yes, that table, that seems to have the special order that was like the dish they ordered but they seem to think was made incorrectly--probably because it was made to my custom order...  No?  You don't think that you accidentally send my special order dish to the wrong table that ordered the same dish without the special order and now that they've taken a couple of bites are sure that this isn't the dish they ordered?  Huh.  That's interesting.  Well, where is their dish?  Is this it, the one you hurriedly brought out to me now that I've reminded you that I did order with the rest of my table but not a dish that clearly isn't mine because it's just the normal version of the dish?  No?  It's not?  You're taking it back to the kitchen and then half a second later bringing it to the other table?  How very interesting.  This was pretty sad.  We'd had two fabulous weekend in a row here, and then this.  I have to say, the plantains were still fabulous.  But that's not dinner.  I want my dinner.  And I want you to be willing to nuke my black beans.  It takes a minute.  I know you can make a minute.  I don't want your attitude.  That takes more than a minute, for some reason.  Why is this?  Maybe the answer is don't go on Friday.  Saturdays?  Always awesome.  Sundays?  Fab-o!  Friday?  Strike!

rGAa2L3I1B5lsdtyIeUxEw.text: To start off with, the location is excellent, it is right in the heart of uptown. The staff was very professional and friendly. The overall upkeep of the restaurant was very clean and there was no wait when I arrived. The server was super nice when suggesting what items to have. The food was very good comparing to the other Mexican food in Charlotte. The prices were reasonable and overall it was a very good experience! We will definitely be back!

TfMz_5wz9jUgTnuRfzDtCQ.text: Chilaquiles are one of my favorite dishes when I go to any Mexican restaurant so I always like to try them out and see who does them the best. These were a little bit fancy yet they still had an amazing authentic taste. I got the small portion which was placed on a small skillet with a layer of refried beans at the bottom of the nachos which were covered in a delicious green salsa with Mexican cheese,radish, onion and an egg on top over easy.

4N7kY247W42UiMNUMDorvg.text: Out of all the places I visited on my weekend trip to Charlotte, Que Onda was my favorite! We started with the Guacamole del Mercado, which has cotija cheese, bacon, corn and pico de gallo mixed in. Best guacamole ever! The add-ins really kicked it up a notch for someone who wants to be adventurous but they have a classic guacamole as well. They have an impressive drink menu that boasts several types of margaritas, and an entire menu dedicated to just tequila! You can even try a sample flight of tequila, either horizontal or vertical. I had a margarita and it tasted so crisp and fresh. I got a taco combination as my entree; I chose Al Pastor, grilled steak and Alambre (my favorite). This place has a great menu, everything was presented/plated well, and our server was absolutely fabulous! I will absolutely be back here on my next trip to Charlotte!

k4oCdCWEaO0JHn_MHD8hpA.text: On January 8, 2019 I had the pleasure of dining with Que Onda Tacos. Yes, a Taco Tuesday!!!! I ordered 2 tacos the Chicken Tinga and Ground Beef. I'd have to say the Chicken Taco was really good and tasteful. On the other hand, the Ground Beef had no flavor. I also didn't like the fact that the beef was served as 2 or 3 balls on my Taco. Personally, I like my beef separated throughout Taco. My table ordered Guacamole and it was really good, I'd order that again.   Our server was very pleasant and familiar with the menu which made for great service. I'd dine here again, but just try something else.

mKryRcgClAKJ5dJfvsiMXQ.text: Solid spot for Mexican food in Uptown. They have a nice little patio (dogs welcome), daily specials and an expansive tequila selection. The complimentary chips and salsa are very good and I'm also a big fan of their queso. Tacos come with 3 per order (you can mix and match) and are a good size. The Que Onda salad is also very good- I love that it comes with jicama for some extra crunch. I am not a fan of their chicken tortilla soup as it is cream based. I order the skinny margaritas and they're good, not great (I think they go a little overboard with the agave or whatever sweetener they use). Service each time I have visited has been quick and friendly. Definitely worth a visit if you're craving Mexican!

d3X6SDety6d4AgJmM0ZM8Q.text: WOW.  Went here for lunch with my team (total of 6 of us).  We arrived shortly before noon and the restaurant was pretty much empty so we were promptly seated and serviced.  Ordered from the lunch menu - the taco meal.  Food came out quickly.  I enjoyed one chicken, one carnitas, both in corn tortillas with rice and beans on the side.  Presentation was adorable - a little slate type slab with taco holders and rice and beans in separate small bowls. The portion was enough for lunch and wow was the flavor great! The chicken tinga did have a little kick to it, but not too much, although I like spicy foods.   The tacos were a little full to pick up and eat so I ate some of the filling first with a fork, but after that they were easy and the tortillas stood up to the juice from the meats.  Highly recommend this place and I will definitely be back with others and hopefully next time order a drink (or two)!

hGIrru1uySJazc8fsO673A.text: Worth it to go here on a Tuesday for $1 tacos. My boyfriend really enjoyed the chicken tinga tacos and I enjoyed my steak! Service was great- we came with a big party and were seated outdoors. Waitress' were super friendly and helpful. They took great care of us!

CNZ0XYEBOyg-q-j0i1cNHw.text: Great food and service! My favorite lunch special item is the Quesadilla Meal which has 3 large quesadillas with Mexican rice, beans and my favorite crema. This lunch portion is very filling! Definitely try them!

v94yl8nn0qEcl0fZfGd-5g.text: Stopped by Que Onda with a few friends from work. I recommended the place, so I hoped it would be good - I was right.   The chips were okay, the salsa was GREAT. You can always judge a place by their salsa, and this passed the test. I ordered the Coca-Cola Carnitas tacos, which, despite the name, were not overly sweet or even sweet at all. They were delicious! I believe they had a happy hour but I didn't check out the specials.  The service was great, especially since I was there with a group of about 10 people. All of our food came out astonishingly fast. SO fast. We were able to get a full meal in and make it to the baseball game on time. If you're headed to the BB&T Ballpark for a game, this is the best place to grub, as it's only a 4-minute walk away.

u5CDIjCCOyQSvVJxi9Oehg.text: Super friendly staff. Guacamole made right at the table ... impressive and delicious.

FS4bpFXJhaX6CcuGTjFD_A.text: I had the taco salad with steak and it was delicious - light and refreshing and flavorful.  My dinner companions raved about their tacos.  The free queso that we received for checking in was not bad, but the guacamole stole the show! The frozen sangria was perfect for a hot day.  Would definitely return next time I am visiting Charlotte.

rBv2XcI581OzFyenOYIdCw.text: Rude bartender/manager. I order take out from here all the time since I stay next door, the food is okay, however bad customer service ruined the place for me.

TVf5c8FAIHEPU0jSmSV7nQ.text: We tried to make a reservation to the uptown location using Yelp. We received confirmation from Yelp via both text and email, however when we got to the restaurant they informed us they do not take reservations via Yelp.  The manager on duty was not very helpful, however the owner really made it happen to ensure we were still able to be seated (even though all of their large party tables were filled, he pulled two smaller ones together) and then got us a round of drinks for our trouble. His customer service and hospitality was outstanding.  Every single one of our party was extremely satisfied with our food. Our only "complaint" was that the tacos were too full to pick up. Sizzling nachos and queso was fantastic.   All in all, what could have been a really disappointing situation around the reservations, turned into a great evening with great food. We would definitely return--and call to make our reservations :)

HbwDP-WkaC9QjO085c8LoA.text: Pork carnitas, braised beef and chicken tacos amazing! Jabenero sauce so delicious and hot on a whole different level.

vvQs1rX5K_EJpRoylnqkug.text: Ran across this place online. Me and my baby sister like yo consider ourselves connoisseurs especially of Tacos. They are not your average cliche taco spot. Starting with the Pineapple Pico,Chipotle Queso, and some type of liquid love they call Salsa Verde it's amazing. I could go on and on but I'm still here and I want to finish my last taco! Don't be a square get here soon! You won't be sorry.

68pi641B-6sZy1qyTne-2A.text: Very energizing tequila bar with the best street tacos. Vibrant colors and great atmosphere. Salsa was great served with fresh tortilla chips. I had the Baja fish tacos & my friend had the steak both very delish! I was impressed with how clean this restaurant is. Wait staff was awesome. Everyone seemed happy to be working, even in the holiday. Wish I lived here, I would visit everyday to try everything on the menu.

Kf2-dhNMb9l3a9tOaqgQ6g.text: My family and I were in town and decided to try this spot.  The food pics were legit and you get a free queso with check in. The salsa and queso was pretty good, nice atmosphere, but HORRIBLE SERVICE.... after ordering our food (tacos) 20 mins go by and I have to flag down the waiter to ask what's going on , he comes back to tell us that it's going to be 15 more minutes  !!!!! people who arrived after us were enjoying there food while we were still waiting on ours.  It DOESNT take an hour to throw some tacos together, no one came to apologize or acknowledge that they screwed up so we left.. I'm guessing he never put the order in! NEVER AGAIN, I'll go elsewhere when I come in town

jQnu9XuaHSk8Y47l1hY3Bg.text: Great menu! Great location and the outside seating was refreshing. Our waitress, aside from being pretty cute with her choker chain, provided excellent service and great suggestions. Drinks were well priced and quite tasty. I will return for more.

UQ7VZ2NoOrSSS27W9xNOEg.text: A great place for lunch at a good price.  I've been several times and the food and service have always been good.  The chicken burrito lunch special is a really good deal, especially with the habanero sauce on it.

ir39QMexnfUZ9QOHZlBurA.text: Queso was great! Also the chicken fajita and strawberry margarita. I didn't care for the sangria though.

FwWlFGChoOdbeHW9wan_2A.text: Great and friendly service. Waiters were very informative of the menu which was great. The guacamole was by far one of the best items on the menu, but the meat in some of the tacos were a bit salty. The Pika Pika drink is very very VERY spicy! So if you're up for a drink challenge with a kick, this is the drink for you! I would visit here again since there are not of Latin restaurants in Uptown Charlotte.

8g1lUfAIqFyzfaHf5WRbSw.text: The food was alright. I didn't love it. But it wasn't bad. The queso was very good but the tacos were just kinda alright. I got the chicken tinga tacos and I've had better. The drinks were also just alright. The margaritas were kinda watered down. But I did enjoy the $5 tequila shots on Friday and Saturday

ReYa82-fI8ZIWWHDMEXd8g.text: Mediocre food. Nothing special at all. Literally. The salsa has little tomato flavor. I had the chicken quesadilla and it was good. I would suggest it. That and the queso. Not the salsa, not any of the rice types. They're bland.

c5i5lz27-n6KX8UN9CA6_A.text: I went to this place with a friend for taco Tuesday, we ordered some guac, whish was amazing, and the taco specials. I ordered one of each flavor, chicken was the best to me. The vibe of the restaurant was really laid back and had a diverse crowd. There was surprisingly no wait time, major plus!

zwk8HHkhw6e2R8q3ceBJPA.text: This place has a surprisingly good Taco Tuesday! 2 dollar tacos and 3 dollar drafts. The queso here is great! Can be pretty pricey though on regular days and Coronas aren't cheap. Overall though, I always enjoy eating here!

QhpJx725VZus4pCSKRjRhA.text: My wife and I love Mexican cuisine, so we decided to give this place a try. The service was outstanding, our server was very generous, therefore we left her a generous tip. The food on the other hand was bland. As a couple of folk who know what authentic Mexican cuisine tastes like, we were kind of disappointed when we left...The decor was so nice, the vibe was very upbeat...The alcohol was WONDERFUL! One of the things they could have nailed was the queso, but it too was bland. No taste from anything...I still have high hopes for this place. We will try once more in the future. If the food is the same, we will just get drinks and leave. After all, we all know the real deal is on the east side of Charlotte lol.

ySYw9XgDSkBA78DMCihPcg.text: Food was very good, loved the queso! I would not recommend if you are looking for a spot for a quick lunch as it took about an hour.

DPQIpB-gPN9T58Qmn2bP_w.text: Food was pretty good. The tortilla chips were some of the best I've had, but that guacamole was way too heavy on the tomatoes and onions. The tortas are huge, big enough to split, and the Milanese was very good. The tacos are also pretty legit, especially the Baja fish.   BUT the service is just terrible. Literally took us like 2 hours to complete our meal of two entrees just because the server was so slow. Took us 15 minutes to get our drinks that we ordered, not to mention they forgot to even bring out one of the two entrees we ordered until we asked twice.   Decent food, decent prices, bad service, would not go back. There are just better places to grab a bite in Charlotte.

aHQ93sZP_OtCG2f3xS-hkA.text: Good food, good service.  The chips are so crispy and not oily and the salsa is really good.  Recommend ordering the nachos.

7fhT7rlPquNZj8-mBRq7nA.text: This place is the jam...it's not been too busy when I've been there. Up to like 4 visits now, but it's consistent and dangerous at the same time, dangerous referring to the Tequila and Mezcal selection...I just stopped in for some tacos, didn't realize I was making a day out of it.   Great lunch spot. Tellem' Tony sent ya!

WhlNVXrPhotWKUVMqaDZUA.text: We decided to try this place out after our trip to ImagincOn. Being new to Charlotte, we figured we'd give this place a shot considering the good yelp reviews. Mind you, we've lived in SoCal so we know what good Mexican food tastes like.   Let's start with the complimentary chips salsa. My husband and I disagreed on the quality of chips. I thought they had an old, stale texture but my husband thought they were decent. The salsa was probably the worst salsa we've ever had. It tasted like tomato sauce poured straight out of the can with some seasoning poured over.   We decided to try the queso dip to see if it'll be any better..tasted like dorito cheese mixed with watered down sour cream topped with cilantro. After each one of us tried a dip, it was a wrap. No bueno.  For the main dish, I tried the combination taco plate ; fish, shrimp, and lengua tacos. The fish taco was fantastic! It was definitely the highlight of the meal. The lengua (tongue) was definitely simply rewarmed, not fresh. The shrimp was....it looked like cheap shrimp one would use to go fishing with. It was more batter then anything. The retried beans and rice? It was either right out of the can and microwaved, or a few days old and microwaved. In our opinion, it was inedible.  Husband tried the chicken, al pastor, and the jt steak carne asada tacos. They were tasty tacos but again, the sides were inedible.  I also ordered a passion fruit mojito which was undeniably the Welch passion fruit juice (I know because I frequently buy it!). Barely any alcohol and way too sweet. Did not finish.  My daughter had the kids meal chicken Tacos, for an 8 year old, they were good.  Also, when we were initially sat, we noticed a couple gentlemen leave because all of their utensils were dirty. They checked two tables, and both plates were dirty as well.   Service was mediocre. The waitress noted that we did not finish anything on our plates and didn't take the time to ask if anything was wrong.  To sum this up, if you come here solely for the street tacos (and nothing else is open), try this place out.

EJnZ6mVyH4oL-ibygWDelg.text: I work down the street from Que Onda so decided to stop by for Taco Tuesday. They have $2 tacos all day on Tuesdays and you can choose from chicken tinga, ground beef, carnitas, veggie, or braised beef.   I split a dip trio appetizer with a friend which includes guacamole, queso and pico. I love chips and dip so I enjoyed all three. The guacamole was a little salty and not as thick as accustomed to but had a good flavor. The house salsa is also very tasty so I was in a good spot with all these dips.  I ordered me some of the taco specials and ordered a chicken tinga, ground beef and veggie. The chicken tinga was really good, very flavorful and included plenty of meat. The ground beef was also very good. The veggie was good but not as good as the others. It included mushrooms and zucchini as the main veggies.  In addition to great taco specials they also have $3 draft beer on special which includes local crafts on draft. I couldn't pass up on this so I ordered a Dos Equis to go with the meal. What a great pairing.   This was a great lunch spot and will be back for more Taco Tuesday!

pdfc7yCCAxzMi0wFs8DLpA.text: I've been getting their salmon tacos meal (comes with rice and beans) with a side of guacamole every time I'm visiting Charlotte for work. I make it a point to get this at least once for dinner. Love the tacos and the guacamole is good too. Their service is pretty quick. I usually order to go and I'm in and out in 15 mins at this place.

eDHufZETLFu01Ts7fsQUPg.text: I went during the evening of a Taco Tuesday with a couple friends. We did not have to wait long. We were seated at a high top table. Tacos are $1 on Tuesdays :)  For ME, I was not impressed to be honest. I ordered the chicken tacos and two of the veggie tacos. My friend received a free queso & dip for checking into Yelp. That "coupon" is only redeemable for one per table FYI.   The queso and dip was SMALL, but really good. The chips weren't stale; crispy & fresh. I love queso, so I liked it. The tacos weren't all that good. I had asked for sour cream on the side & never received it. I put a little bit of Of the queso on my tacos because they were a little dry.  The veggie tacos tasted weird.   The waitress was not the friendliest. You could tell she was there "just to do her job". She was kind of dismissive and not attentive to our table.

8qoXhDhhtsglpLbUpMF1lw.text: After an exhausting day at the amusement park , my friends and I decided to take part in Taco Tuesday. We were greeted and given a table immediately. Upon checking in I was gifted with free queso. The dip was sooooooo good! It was runny but flavor wise it was the best one I've had. We were also given salsa and chips . I liked both .  I ordered two $2 chicken tacos. My friends ordered either chicken or the market veggie tacos. The tacos were small but filling. I didn't like the texture of my tortillas. I'm not sure if they are used just for the special or not. I think it was a corn tortilla. I did use some salsa and queso on my tacos to give it a little more flavor.  Our waitress was nice but it wasn't much interaction as we were in and out. Overall, I'd come back.

Love that they give complimentary chips and salsa, definitely great for the kiddos who need something to much on while waiting for entrees. Service was great too!

Man, these tacos have so much flavor, and really pretty reasonably priced. I got 3 tacos of my choice with Mexican rice and beans for side for only $12.95! It's walking distance from my office in uptown, which is really awesome. Definitely try this place out when you are craving tacos!

-0cKr8H1xF40i6MiYzxuqg.text: My oh my! I am extremely impressed by this restaurant! The best tacos I've tasted in the QC! This was my first time here and I'm glad I stopped by. I tried tacos al pastor which is served with pineapple. Who would have ever thought pineapple on tacos would be so good?! These tacos are so loaded with meat that they spill out of the tortilla. The meats are seasoned with that Spanish sazon! The guacamole is to die for! It's made freshly on your table.   This restaurant was poppin' when we got there. Waiting line was out the door. Such a great atmosphere to be in. I wish the location was much bigger to accommodate more guests. Service was wonderful. This is now my new favorite location to get tacos! Great job guys!

ETw1FI85Ph05Kfk05OqlrA.text: This was very delicious and our waiter was so sweet and friendly! First to hit the table were the chips and salsa. Being a Yelper, the check in came with a free chipotle queso and both items were delicious! There were plenty of drink specials for each day of the week and it was a great lunch spot!  I got the taco salad which was very good and my friend got the fajitas which came with the fix ins of retried beans, rice, pico de gallo and lettuce! We will be back!

Ui9chINW5SOGDbMvaZMkDg.text: Solid Tex-Mex spot. Flavorful tacos and dips. Has indoor and outdoor seating and a small bar for seating as well. Cute day of the dead themed decor and murals throughout the spot. We grabbed tacos and fajitas alongside the salad and queso {free thanks yelp} dip. Chips were flowing and margaritas were tasty. Service was amazing and we would def go back when we come back in town.

H1I_CvMqMrf01y6hxx-nMg.text: Working at one of the best taco and tequila places in Charlotte has my expectations very high.  Service was good. Frozen margarita, strong and good.  Food, bad.  Everything had no seasoning at all. The fajitas tasted more burnt and had to be doused in salt, and topped with a lot of guacamole. The salsa tasted like tomato water. I hate to say it.  The chicken soup was probably the best thing that I've tried. Perfect broth, heat and tender chicken.  Unfortunately, I don't think I'll make another stop here but good service and cute vibe!

dfeZdsLFEFJ0hn2gPmppUA.text: The place is Super cute and was in walking distance from my hotel .   We were looking for a place that could accommodate the meat eater in our group , a vegetarian and pescatarian and this place for the bill .  Not crowded at all through the week , daily drink and food specials and FREE queso if you check in on yelp .  We ordered just fine .. here's where we had some issues .. there were 3 of us , the brought 2 of the meals to our table and took 1 to a random table . Once we retrieved that meal ... we noticed it was incorrect (not fish yet chicken tacos ) and also noticed that the meat eaters meal was incorrect , he did not receive beans and rice , yet 2 orders of beans . He brought this to the servers attention , she said she misunderstood , yet never took care of it .   My meal ..came with cheesy rice (something like velveta mixed with rice ) .. reminded me of my college days .. the veggie enchiladas were good , seasoned well etc .  I'd go for the chips and guacamole for sure !

xC9iYfKRV6f2H-iNxe9TRQ.text: This was a fun casual place. The food was okay, nothing really special and honestly I was hopeful they'd be a bit better but not bad either.   I'd go back but I'd make sure I got pico to give the tacos a little more flavor besides just meat and tortilla.   The trio appetizer was really good and the amount of guacamole was surprisingly large.

photos.caption: Photo of Que Onda Tacos + Tequila - Charlotte, NC, United States. 3 Amigos Trio with chorizo.

yDoXV0smOTqVm-cPCb0KiQ.text: If it's Taco Tuesday, this is my go to place. My man Angel is always on point! The tacos aren't the greatest of all time, but for $2, you can't beat the good portion and flavor! Tequila selection is great, locale is great - keep up the good work folks!

3sGxgk5jqDjJsBBlBiMMFA.text: This review is for their Taco Tuesday special.   My team at work was celebrating a coworker birthday so we were looking for a place in Uptown that could seat a big group. It was a beautiful sunny day so we decided to try out Que Onda. They were able to push some tables together for us outside.   We took advantage of the Yelp check-in to get free queso, and it was really good! Most of us ordered the tacos (they are pretty small--street taco sized), someone ordered plaintains, and one person order the taco salad. Everyone enjoyed their food.  Our server was great. He was super busy and we waited for water and chip refills, but they eventually came out. The food took a little while to come out, so I'd recommend planning on a long lunch (or arrive early).  I regret not ordering the taco salad, so I will order that the next time I go.  p.s. I'm not sure if there is dedicated parking because we walked.

2lAPVBGpJ9gTHQ0nFgixTw.text: Was wanting some Mexican food on a Tuesday and this place did not disappoint. There was not a wait and the weather was perfect to sit outside. Our waiter was extremely detailed when describing drinks and their food items.  The margaritas had the perfect amount of tequila and were very practical in price. The food was amazing .  I order the chicken Suizas and I had to force myself to stop eating. All the ingredients were fresh and seemed to be made to order. The queso was the perfect temperature and the right amount of gooeyness, i was in heaven.  The restaurant was clean and the staff was friendly. Our food came out fast and steaming.  Our bill was not too bad, but it was worth every penny due to the level of food that was presented.  I would definitely be back for a day other than Tuesday because they have specials all throughout the week.  If you like Tex Mex this is the place for you !

9Q-809YQOa1ZInNBRU-N6w.text: I had a steak taco, salmon and the pulled chicken. The steak and salmon tacos were amazing. Juicy and flavorful. The chicken taco was a just ok. A little bland and definitely could stand alone without some salsa and sour cream. We also had the triple dipper appetizer which included guacamole, queso and pico. All three were fresh and delicious and their chips were perfect. The margaritas were perfect and my husband loved his Bloody Mary. Service was very efficient. We will definitely go back when in Charlotte.

-Akcgly4bKVKa3VFp0P7Vw.text: This place is awesome!! Our server was wonderful friendly and took very good care of us. My husband got the fish tacos and said they were delicious. I got the taco salad and ate like I was in a race. It had beans and fresh corn right off the cob. I loved the salsa and used it as the dressing. My son and GF got the veggie tacos and ate every bite. I wish I could Show you more picture but we literally ate everything !  We are new to The area and will be coming back for sure. It's in walking distance to many downtown Apts.

5LH-iWl1dp4g1a3t_HOLNQ.text: Came here with my friend after work. We ordered the traditional guac....so good!! The chips were fresh and hot..salsa very good as well. As far as our entrees, we were not that impressed. I ordered the fried chicken torta..chicken was tough and didn't have a good flavor. My friend ordered the vegetarian tacos and didn't particularly enjoy them either. Overall, our waiter was very attentive and provided great service. Would definitely be back for apps and the chips and salsa!

MGQpmFbIjRcZ1ON9l2-ZUg.text: I highly recommend the carnitas tacos or suiza enchiladas! Those are my go-to orders. Que Onda also provides the best chips & salsa of any Mexican place I've ever been to.

tSJTv-fTvNHyJMaGMS_Y4g.text: Be warned! The chips and salsa are amazing and you won't stop eating them. Ate so many that I couldn't finish my tacos. The mixed veggie taco had something delicious in it and the steak taco had glorious chunks of medium rare steak. The skinny margarita was also verb delicious.

UDSqR7_dfW3n-U6UpWv2JQ.text: We went for lunch on opening day.  We were nervous about the service but it ended up being excellent. The servers were very attentive and knowledgeable about the menu.  We also lucked out because Tuesday's are Taco days and tacos were only $2.00 each!  The cheese dip has a kick but it is delicious. The guacamole was good but I'm not usually a fan. They say they make it table side but they already have everything in the bowl when they come to your table and then they mix it together in front of you.  I thought it would be more like Rosa Mexicana where they come with all the ingredients and actually make it in front of you.    The beef was very salty. I actually didn't eat most of my three tacos.  What really made me question coming back was when we asked for a refill on our drinks and the server said he would "grab me another one."  I looked over the menu and didn't see anything about drinks being charged by the glass.  Sure enough, the sweet tea I was drinking was about $2.75 per glass.  We were there for a while so I had four.  That's ridiculous to me.  Especially since it's not noted on the menu in any way.

vjPxhHaNZ1RKktXe3khDhw.text: Excellent salsa, great selection of tequilas, great food, lovely decor, really excellent service. Great daily specials. We think it's the best Mexican place in Charlotte.

sZXivqA4On1S9SddJz2YGw.text: My friends wanted to check this place out, and I almost didn't go because by looking online, it appears that NOTHING is vegan-friendly. However, I decided to give it a shot (if all else fails, chips and guac and tequila are a great meal, right?). After asking our server, she confirmed that the rice and beans are vegan, so I ordered the vegetarian tacos without cheese, and added beans and rice. I also got a couple cocktails. All was pretty good. The zucchini in the tacos was cooked to perfection. Their chips are great, the salsa is just ok. Unfortunately, I ended up being charged for both the rice and beans, but didn't get any money taken off for omitting the cheese or cream sauce. I would not go back unless someone I was with really wanted to. If they added more explicit vegan options to their menu, then I'd go back and try it again.

9Q87lpAuB_e1SPQPkEJ_-g.text: Want to get some of the worst service ever? Cmon down to Que Onda. I've been here four times and I wanted to like this place, really did, but every single time I've gone in there I've had horrible service. Food takes forever, orders are wrong, I order drinks, they never come, but I'm charged for them. I made a reservation, arrived, I was told that they had no tables and that I'd have to wait 30 minutes . . . THEN WHY DID YOU BOOK THE RESERVATION AND NOT TELL ME THAT BEFORE I DROVE THERE???

iAvLBBjSKfi1i7Kjmrs-Nw.text: I've eaten here and ordered delivery. Eating there has been decent, the waiters tend to forget drink orders or bring them to the wrong table often, but otherwise service good, and food too. My main issue was with delivery that I ordered a few days ago. My wife and I both got enchiladas, and when they came they both had some Sort of wax paper stuck to the bottom of them, as if maybe they were heated up in a microwave on this paper and then were just dumped into the box? It was tough to tell if on purpose or a mistake. What I CAN say is that enchiladas are tough to eat when there's wax paper stuck to them, it stays stuck to the bottom of each piece you try to eat. I ended up trying to pull the wax paper out, failed, threw the whole thing away. I guess I'll just stick to either eating in or ordering delivery from Somewhere else.

pPP_kUgaZWidrie1B5s5XA.text: Stopped in on a Saturday for lunch. They have outdoor street level seating. Latin music was playing,margaritas were good and the server was fast and friendly. Ordered the nachos and street tacos. We asked the server for the hottest salsa they had. And boy did he deliver (fire) overall perfect little spot. JSznoMUJVfyLkJf-aieHHQ.text: Que Onda is the type of place I go to when I'm looking for a quick dinner or a cheap lunch. I came here on two separate occasions so I'm basing my rating off the average of the two experiences.   The ambiance: Cute, very modern, and clean. Cute star lights hanging from the ceiling, a homey Spanish speaking staff, and a man who seems to be the owner or manager making his rounds to make sure everyone is having a good experience. Good, lively Spanish music at just the right volume that you can hear your dinner partner.   First time around, I ordered the horchata and the three taco combo of Baja shrimp, beef, and fish. The shrimp was by far my favorite. Citrusy flavors that cut into the mild flavors of the shrimp. The horchata was good--yummy cinnamon flavors and the nuttiness of the rice. A little bit more ice than I liked, because by the end, my horchata was diluted and tasted like nutty. (3.5/5 for this meal) Not bad.  Second time around, I ordered the enchilada mole ($15). It was okay. The mole sauce had a hint of cocoa (which is what I was looking for), but other than that, the dish was bland and fell flat. The rice was some sort of fried rice stir-fried in carrots and peas, and the refried beans were more liquified than thick. Both the rice and the beans weren't phenomenal, nor did they have any distinct flavors. BUT I have to give it to them, the presentation was very good. (2/5 for the enchilada mole)  The star of the show are the chips and salsa. They came out hot and were accompanied by this smoky, earthy salsa that I devoured. I think I ate more of the chips than my meals. (4/5)  I really want this place to thrive, because the owner does a great job making sure you're accounted for. The staff is really friendly, (and you can tell that they enjoy being around each other), and one of the owners that I met was so nice and chatted with me about the different hot sauces that Que Onda has for those that are looking for a nice 'kick.' I really want to root for this place. I will come back because I want to see Que Onda thrive.

d8kF9HnJpuy5kHhRoI7wlQ.text: The tacos are AMAZING! I've come to this place at least 6 times in the last 2 months.

photos.caption: Photo of Que Onda Tacos + Tequila - Charlotte, NC, United States. Baja Fish Tacos! So good.

jumUuAtGctlPoCS8bKW_lg.text: I love this little joint....the service is fast & friendly and the food is always on point....it's dog friendly .....also....you get a complimentary queso if you check in!

qZtQa1a6Y1jJDkQs0NSOKA.text: So in love with this place!!! Awesome drinks, food, and service! Must try the frozen sangria! It will change your life!!!

DzPop0bsHLLmtR1THNspIg.text: I'm going back.  They had the best guac I have ever eaten.   Yelp check-in got us a queso chipotle dip.  Tacos are usually served on corn tortillas, but when asked came on lettuce for a low carb diner.  We were there for lunch so didn't have cocktails.  The drinks menu looked interesting, though and they have a HUGE variety of tequilas.

d-ue4E30BROxvbckxTXSBg.text: Great tacos & greater service.    Myself and a friend ended up back at Que Onda for lunch, within a week of our first visit.  This time I was impressed because although it was busy, a server stepped up and took care of our order once she realized that we had been waiting for a while and our original server was busy.    During both visits we ordered, tacos.  My favorite taco is the shrimp taco (which is available by request).  The shrimp was grilled with a smokey seasoning that compliments the cabbage slaw perfectly.  If you like spice make sure to ask for the avocado cream sauce on the the side, it has a kick.  Now I am looking forward to coming back for dinner to try their drinks, as I would probably order tacos again.

BU1mYsKNQeziJf1Mf82DFQ.text: This place is pretty good.  My friend and I were stressed out because we were gonna take an exam the next day, therefore margaritas were a must.  We each got a marg, 2 of the happy hour tacos and shared the chips and queso.  So filling!  Make sure to check in for the free queso!

5P8qmEI947TJm6uI2Uakxw.text: I agree that Que Onda is here to stay.  Definitely a solid place downtown to grab some great fast casual mexican with an excellent selection of tacos.  I've been twice now and  tried a few different street tacos when I went.  Most of them were good not fantastic, but the Crispy Baja Fish Taco was out of this world.  The fish was light and crisp complimented perfectly by the chipotle aioli.  The chips and salsa were also on point and definitely filling if you eat too many.  Lots of choices on the menu and hope to try more but the street tacos are a pretty good value and my favorite.  For a casual place the ambiance and service here was exceptional and its a great addition to Uptown especially if you're getting a quick bite to eat before heading to a Knights game or just Uptown for lunch or even dinner in some cases.  Will return.

2Uq84eOT-NYuTAp0XNTKVQ.text: Super cute atmosphere. Seating area outside was inviting and comfortable. My waiter, Jose, was very attentive and knowledgeable about menu items. I got shrimp fajitas and they were good with a large portion. The queso and salsa was BOMB. Highly recommend to anyone looking for a good Mexican restaurant in uptown Charlotte.

7bwYcIcDCN05Ioi2-soB9g.text: 1 Star for garlicky desserts. I got a tres leches cake and a flan to go. When I opened the box, they both looked good and were generously portioned for the prices. However, my first bite of the cake yielded a strong garlic flavor. So did the whipped cream. And the sauce. It seemed like they had kept the desserts and whipped cream in the fridge too long with something very garlicky! It ruined the taste of the dessert. The flan had a slight garlic taste so it might have been fresher, but it was still not edible as a dessert, which was a shame because it seemed like a good, creamy rich flan. A restaurant should know better to keep desserts away from heavy garlic. However this did make me think that their guacamole would be fantastic.

RyRo3WCqDTMI7tgQkgNS2A.text: Yep- pretty tasty fish tacos. The food here was amazing. Our waitress forgot our cheese dip from the yelp check in but no worries. Decor is fitting and colorful. Definitely will be stopping by next time I'm in Charlotte.

photos.caption: Photo of Que Onda Tacos + Tequila - Charlotte, NC, United States

IVKEAhRtFhDL84GGQ2ZNCw.text: Tried this place out for lunch yesterday and I was pleasantly surprised. Wasn't expecting a whole lot just based on the track record of the previous tenets of this space.   The food came pretty quickly after we ordered. It was a cold and windy day, so I went with the lunch special half milanesa torta and cup of soup. The milanesa at Bakersfield is one of my favorites, but I'd put this one on par with, or maybe a little above that one. The chicken had just the right amount of crunch, the queso was toasted onto the bread-which gave it a sort of grilled cheese flavor component; it was just all around delicious. The soup was also fantastic; it was a kinda tomatoey tortilla soup with plenty of chicken in it, and was more hearty than I had anticipated. My only complaint was that the potato chips (which I didn't really want anyway) were a little under cooked and slightly soggy.  As is always the case with Mexican restaurants, I regret having ate too much of the chips and salsa/queso before my meal came, and therefore not being able to finish the food. I would blame that on the excellent service... our waitress never allowed us to reach the last chip in our basket, and my glass was never less than half full.   I will 100% for sure be giving Que Onda more of my money.

photos.caption: Photo of Que Onda Tacos + Tequila - Charlotte, NC, United States. Half Milanesa Torta and soup.

zsSfc8m8_BvOppNT10BqVA.text: Food was great, but don't go in a hurry.  Went for lunch with a group on taco Tuesday. Got there early and beat the crowds so we had no trouble getting seated. Loved the fresh made chips and salsa, tasty variety of tacos and creamy guajillo rice. Unfortunately there was some confusion with the orders and again in paying the tabs, so it took over an hour to get through lunch.  I'm told this was not a normal experience but makes it hard to put this on my list of regular lunch places.

iWyiMPL0MUyeb-vVQYuBGg.text: Is this place doomed? How many restaurants have been here before Que Onda? I can remember at least three.   Service was problematic, but I'll give the benefit of the doubt since they've only been open a few weeks. I mentioned that I wanted the $2 taco special, and our server had to turn around to scan the specials board to make sure my request was legit. After my coworker placed her order, our server tried to talk her into a different special that was in no way related to what she ordered. And then she had to confirm my order again before she left.  The food is pretty good. The flavor of everything we ordered was fine, but the temperatures were all over the place. My coworker's tacos were cold. Mine were warm, but the tortillas were completely saturated, telling me they sat for awhile before our server brought them over. My plantains were lava hot and my rice was room temp. Seems like the kitchen could work on their timing.   As we were wrapping up and waiting for the check, a different server came by to ask us if everything had been alright. He did that hands-on-knees stance you use when you're talking to children or puppies. It was uncomfortable. And then he stuck around for several minutes aggressively trying to teach my companion several phrases in Spanish. I could have done without the entire interaction.  Once they work out the kinks, this might be a decent lunch option. Uptown is sorely lacking in good taco places, so I hope the experience improves before the next restaurant moves into this location.

photos.caption: Photo of Que Onda Tacos + Tequila - Charlotte, NC, United States. Plantains, creamy rice, and tacos on special.

mtUwJ0Wa3vsksQ4eeqrP1Q.text: Yeah, this is not good food.. guacamole was more like pico de gallo with a scent of avocado. Tacos were okay but not really tasty, and the salsas were "meh".  Staff was friendly and decor was nice and that's why they get thr two stars.  Uptown needs a real quality mexican restaurante.

jO-a4hxiZ4Ncj98atg2oiw.text: Very cute spot!! Love the decor!! The strawberry margarita was Bomb!!! Went there for $2 Taco night. I had the chicken taco and the veggie taco. The chicken was ok. The meat was shredded with a hot sauce that tasted like Texas Pete. Now the veggie taco was awful! I don't think zucchini and squash should be made into a taco period! The textures did not blend well with the mushrooms or the avocado sauce that came with it! If anything i will be back for the drinks! The chips and queso where good too! zuvGB2K0ImxavWc6qbPlmQ.text: If you go on Thursday you're guaranteed to get the best margaritas in Charlotte for an amazing price. My girlfriend and I both had the combo taco entrees. Three tacos each but we had to get a fourth to test out the extensive menu. She had the braised beef, crunchy shrimp, grilled steak and tinga del chicken...all excellent choices. I had the crunchy shrimp as well, Coca Cola carnitas, al pastor and the crispy Baja fish. I can't even say which taco was the best because they were all heavenly. My girlfriend grew up eating authentic Mexican food and Que Onda has quickly become one of her favorite places. Back to the margaritas though...$5 went a long way at Que Onda. Ended up on our third round before eating the last taco. Anxiously anticipating my next visit here. Likely coming on $2 Taco Tuesday.

txxHml5u_yIptHG_rLTaTg.text: If you are looking for a place to indulge on tacos for Taco Tuesday, don't look here.  Short version: Trendy location, great for Instagram but the food lacks flavor, the drinks are over priced and watered down and the service was just ok.  Long version: Excited for my first Taco Tuesday in Charlotte my party of 3 and I decided to try out this spot based on the great reviews and proximity. We were greeted and seated right away (6:30pm). We ordered a selection of tacos from the regular menu as well as the specials. One person ordered a burrito and 2 people ordered drinks.  While we waited, we enjoyed the music selection and taking pics of the beautiful artwork (mostly Day of the Dead themed). When our food came, the presentation was nice and we were all excited to dig in. What disappointment! For starters, the tacos are miniature. The tortillas they were wrapped in couldn't be larger than 4" (standard taco tortillas are closer to 8"). I ordered hanger steak, al pastor and market veggie. The most flavorful was the market veggie as it was just grilled and seasoned veggies. The hanger steak and al pastor had seasoning but the appropriate flavors just were not there. It also seemed like they use other cuts of meat.  The burrito was especially bad. The person who ordered it couldn't even eat half of it and when the rest of us tried it, we all agreed it wasn't worth eating...no flavor.  The tacos on special were slightly better but definitely not worth going back for.  I ordered a hot tea, I wasn't given any options so I assumed it was hot black tea (like most other places serve). I was given chamomile, which I am not a fan of. Whatever, it was the only hot beverage besides coffee. Someone ordered La Flaca which was basically a $9 tall glass of water. We were all so disappointed, we left to get dessert elsewhere because I couldn't risk having them mess up the churros too.  We are not the type to send food back so we just ate what we could and paid. The waitress was nice. The ambiance was good. They do have a pet friendly outdoor seating area as well.  I get really irritated when I feel places in Charlotte that serve non-American food are trying to pass something off as authentic thinking the clientele doesn't know the difference .  With so many other good places in Charlotte, don't bother with this one.

8bHVacEPWa6b_lPx2xDQmw.text: The Tuesday happy hour chicken tacos left a lot to be desired. They were really small. The queso was extremely thin and had clumps of unmelted cheese in it. The taste wasn't horrible but I'm sure it would've been a lot better if it was fully melted. My friend enjoyed the fish tacos. Next time I will ditch the specials and get something else.

ReHfUi1PltePcKQg9Nu9sQ.text: Stopped in last night as we were in town for a concert and it was *National Taco Day*. I had read good reviews of the place and FB pictures of the tacos looked SO good. I'm glad we went won't Que Onda as the thirst Thursday $5 margaritas were great and the $2 select tacos were perfect. I had the braised beef and it was delicious. We also ordered the trio of dips and were not let down on taste or portion. I also ordered a Pepito margarita and it wasn't overly spicy but it was very tasty and full of flavor! I loved the touch of tajin on the rim of the glass. All around we had a great relaxing meal sitting outside before we headed to the spectrum center. It is a quick, short walk and post tacos we were in great moods! Our waitress, Dina, could not have been friendlier. She was very helpful with the menu and night specials and just a delight to talk to in general. I will definitely visit again when we are in the area next. I want to sample all the tacos on the menu as there were several to choose from! As well as a large selection of interesting sounding cocktails! It's a win-win all around! I highly recommend stopping in, especially if you're in town for an event at Spectrum center. I guarantee that you will not be disappointed :)

gQ60os9dV3EG_z1A2QiYAg.text: Been trying to branch out to different places for taco Tuesday instead of the typical taco places in charlotte. My bf speaks highly of this place so we decided to check it out one Tuesday. It was a bit disappointing to see their special didn't have anything to accommodate me because I'm pescatarian, but i didn't let that stop me cause I understand how you don't come across us too often to put such an acquired taste on special. I ordered the Baja fish tacos and was actually pleased because the size of my tacos were way bigger than of my company who were able to order the tacos on special. The fish was fluffy and I liked it only thing I would maybe say is less fish batter it was a bit overwhelming. We also got the chipotle queso and pleaseeeeeeee stop serving this! I get that it's a benefit for yelpers to receive it for free but let's just say that even for free that queso was more than half way full by the time we left and the cheese was never all the way melted to begin with (disgusting). Overall though the service was perfect, the setting is very nice especially since it's getting warmer, and the food was okay. Enough for me to give it another chance but maybe order something different next time.

EreNsQgLzmwhLVNWo3j72g.text: I just wasn't impressed this go around. The food is in need of some seasoning!!! Seriously bland.   The waitress was nice so I can't even say anything negative about her.

zZIEMtiAqHbxNXF3JsyUvg.text: I had dined here once before and wasn't crazy about my experience, but decided to give it a second try as co-workers were heading here for National Margarita day.  It was a beautiful evening and we were able to grab a table on their outdoor patio, which by the way is dog friendly!! We all chose the Thursday drink special- "$5 House On The Rocks Gold Margarita"....$1 extra to make it a tall.  It was good, but could have been a little heavier on the tequila.  Chips and homemade salsa are brought to your table (unlimited refills), and if you check in on Yelp you can receive a FREE order of queso (!!!!!!)  I am not the biggest fan of queso, but Que Onda's version has a unique twist to it as they add chipotle in adobo, which gives it a nice kick.  Since we weren't that hungry, my table ordered one Tinga De Pollo (comes with 3 tacos) (pulled chicken, chipotle tomato, pico de gallo, sour cream) and one of the combination of tacos (pick any 3).  My pick was the Al Pastor (adobo pork shoulder, pineapple pico, cilantro, creamy avocado sauce), which was better than the Tinga De Pollo, although it was slightly too salty for my taste.  The wait time to receive our food was a bit long, but also understandable as the restaurant was very crowded! Our waitress was amazing and apologized profusely when there was a computer error and only one credit card got charged.  At least that person got extra credit card points! I will be back with my dog to try out Taco Tuesday!

IC1haWErw6qLt0GrjsYpXQ.text: Que onda is my favorite Mexican spot Uptown. The food is delicious and the atmosphere is very fun. I have had issues with lunch there in the past (being too long and having to get our food to go), but recently they have stepped up their game significantly.   I highly recommend their dip trio as well as their tacos. You can also get the tacos on lettuce wraps for an additional $1 which seems very reasonable to me. We will be back again soon!

XsbsXivzGlEwZtDRiBWy4A.text: I got a taco salad and chips with queso to go! I called it in so I could run in grab it then get home after a long day at work. I get home and I have no chips for my queso. Thankfully I had tortilla chips in my pantry. Its so very annoying that people can't be more thorough at their job. They weren't even busy and they were actually sitting around when I got there. I work in the restaurant industry and know exactly how people can get slack when it's not busy! Don't do it! Always be on point! Take pride in your job no matter what you do! I always tip on to go orders too and it's things like this that piss me off and regret it.

jlJvXBREVgTk3TguzSiOEg.text: This place was a huge disappointment. After a school field trip I encouraged my peers to go as I once had a great experience here. This time not so much. It took us 15 minutes to even get greeted at the table, the server didn't know the beers that were being served, and seemed highly unknowledgeable. The manager was unsympathetic and lacked common respect when talking to customers, as he was very passive aggressive and honestly quite rude. The only redeeming quality this place had was a very generous customer who was understandable. The town has plenty of taco places who have the same $2 special with much better quality of food and service.

RnOyMQcpQ5A3veEBZyYPNw.text: Delicious!! Truly enjoyed my lunch here. I had the Baja fish tacos and possibly one of the tacos I have eaten. Great quality fish and flavors. Will definitely be returning.

Bib9fZTioC306CKGU1WRcg.text: Wow! This place really surprised me. I've been dying to try this place out and finally made it in for lunch today. I ordered 3 different tacos: Coca Cola carnitas, fish, and a hangar steak. All of the flavors were excellent and the best part was that all of them were fresh and hot! I feel like a lot of taco places in charlotte give you cold or luke warm tacos. The service was very friendly and the menu was diverse. I also loved the warm chips and delicious salsa. I can't wait to come back and try the queso and margs!!
